item.title: CLI tool installation
item.description: Windows Installation | macOS Installation | Linux Installation | Try out the BluBracket CLI commit hook Installing the BluBracket CLI Tool is simple! Download the tool from the BluBracket portal: Login to your BluBracket portal Select Settings from left pane menu Select Code Scanning Download the CLI OS version of your choice (Mac, Windows, Linux) Windows Installation # Extract the files into any directory that is available in PATH.

item.title: Using the CLI tool
item.description: Installation # How do I Install the BluBracket command line interface (CLI) tool? Setting git hooks # In terminal, cd to the repo dir, then blubracket install-git-hooks C:\Users\vbuzu\projects\sandbox>blubracket install-git-hooks Successfully installed pre-commit hook to 'C:/Users/vbuzu/projects/sandbox/.git/hooks/pre-commit' If git is setup to use global git hooks (specified by core.hooksPath git config), CLI will update/install the hook in that global folder. Currently CLI will set only one hook, pre-commit. Current limitations # CLI will install the pre-commit hook automatically only if the hook does not exist yet or the hook does exist and is implemented as a shell script (determined by the presence of #!
